column4: can someone paste the contents of their /boot/grub/default file to a pastebin please?
wtf is an audio drive?
can someone paste the contents of their /boot/grub/default file to a pastebin please?
also, beware cross-os crap
can someone PLEASE paste the contents of their /boot/grub/default file to a pastebin please?
dpkg -S /boot/grub/default
unfortunately  dpkg -S /boot/grub/default won't work for me because i'm on the live cd
i just finished installing ubuntu , performed the updates, rebooted, and not even a grub menu
i'm just trying to figure out if something in /boot/grub became corrupted
not even a grb error?
but if you have any other ideas i'd love to hear them
not even that... the system just hangs
how many drives?
there are 2 hd drives and a dvd drive
if you wind up with grub on both drives it can get confusing
yeah the other drive only has some mythtv recordings on it...
check you don't have grub on the 2nd drive with sudo dd if=/dev/sd# bs=512 count=1 | od -c  - a grub binary will show in there "G   e   o   m  \0   H   a   r   d "
that's how it looks - leave it alone
you sure it's '^0' and not just plain '0' ??
will go double check
my bad, it's 0^@ and then around 10 line breaks...
that's most likely ok
runing dd if=/mnt/hdb1 bs=512 count=1 | od -c didnt tell me much
it did say reading /mnt/hdb1': Is a directory ... this is an error maybe?
